explanations.machine learning: The paper proposes a model (MRRFGNN) that uses machine learning techniques, specifically graph neural networks, to predict stock crash risk.
explanations.unsupervised learning: The model employs self-supervised learning and contrastive learning, which are forms of unsupervised learning, to reconstruct and infer implicit relationships between companies.
explanations.neural network: The paper discusses the use of graph neural networks (GNNs) as a core component of the proposed model.
explanations.deep learning: The proposed MRRFGNN model is a deep learning approach that leverages graph neural networks and attention mechanisms.
explanations.representation learning: The model learns representations of companies and their relationships, which is a key aspect of representation learning.
explanations.attention mechanism: The model incorporates a relation self-attention mechanism to integrate various types of relationships, which is a specific application of attention mechanisms in neural networks.
